channel.title: Tv's of 09?
channel.description: i heard they will be making all new tv's in 2009 and all tv's made before that would need to be upgraded for the new hdd stuff. so what the fuck? i heard my parents talking about it and i never knew if it was true.

item.title: Tv's of 09?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Do you talk about DVB-T/ATSC/ISDB-T?

If that, you don’t need a new TV, only a decoder and a tv that support scart/hdmi.

Read full topic

if this is true, and they put more pron channels on, the indastries could be making millions.

item.title: Tv's of 09?
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

Basically, its no big deal.

If you have an old analog TV, then you just need to go out and get a receiver that gets digital.
Requires nothing more than a box and some cables to hook up to your old crap TV.

I already have an HD receiver, so I won’t have to worry about anything. Just clearer pictures on the regular channels.

Read full topic

item.title: Tv's of 09?
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:9, topic:174928”][quote author=Ii 1337 iI link=topic=235424.msg2006727#msg2006727 date=1200904194]

hes probably talking about the digital switch over in the uk? it happens around 09 where all the normal tvs have to be converted to digital

It’s all over the world, IIRC.

yeah, but why are they doing it? benefit or cause?
[/quote]
Errr, they do it so they can use the analog frequencies for emergency communications, etc.[/quote]
the analog signals are being sold off aka the 700mhz spectrum bid, and has already started…

Block D is being used for a new public safety net
Block C is the one that all the companies like Google and Verizon want to get their hands on for 4.6 billion

en.wikipedia.org

United States 2008 wireless spectrum auction

The United States 700 MHz FCC wireless spectrum auction, officially known as Auction 73, was started by the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) on January 24, 2008 for the rights to operate the 700 MHz radio frequency band in the United States. The details of process were the subject of debate among several telecommunications companies, including Verizon Wireless, AT&T Mobility, as well as the Internet company Google. Much of the debate swirled around the "open access" requirements set d Fu...

Read full topic

item.title: Tv's of 09?
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

Actually,

In 2009, they plan on getting rid of analog signals. The signal everyone will get will be digital.

You will still be able to use your regular tv, but HD ready tvs will automatically get all channels in HD.

Source

Read full topic

item.title: Tv's of 09?

item.description:
@Ii_1337_iI wrote:

[quote=“exps35, post:2, topic:174928”]Doubt it.

They won’t do anything to ruin their own market, and there is no new technology that can wipe out previous models anyways.

There might be, however, something that will require all tv stations to broadcast in digital (I remember hearing a little something about some law trying to get passed.)[/quote]
no, i think they are serious. gov. is supposed to be giving 40$ or something

item.title: Tv's of 09?

item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

Doubt it.

They won’t do anything to ruin their own market, and there is no new technology that can wipe out previous models anyways.

There might be, however, something that will require all tv stations to broadcast in digital (I remember hearing a little something about some law trying to get passed.)
